Granting sudo access for (l)users

  1. We get entitlement request(s) to grant a specific user root ( sudo su - ) access, you should have the following data
    Username : 
Hostname :
  2. An important rule.
    1. The username must be an individual account, not a service account like orata2, ta2adm, plsware etc etc
  3. To grant access to a specific user on a host(s)
    sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo enable <username> <host1> <host2>

    e.g. 

    sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo enable x1kxk630 panmsv02
Granting omnipotent permission for x1kxk630 on panmsv02
  4. To revoke the access
    sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo disable <username> <host1> <host2>

    e.g. 

    sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo disable x1kxk630 panmsv02
Taking away omnipotent like permissions from x1kxk630 on panmsv02

Granting temporary sudo access for somebody who needs it right away or projects which need longer retention ( exceptions )

  1. We can use the above steps to grant the access as long as you have the exception approved by your team manager Robert
  2. We often forget to take the temporary access back.
  3. The following step may also be used when you are on a project and the resource needs “sudo su -” access for an extended period of time + it is approved + is an exception approved by Robert.
  4. In all of the above conditions, please do this after you grant the access. This way, you don't have to remember to remove them manually.
    1. Disable after 1 day
      echo "sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo disable x1kxk630 panmsv02 " | at now + 1 day
    2. Disable after 1 hour
      echo "sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo disable x1kxk630 panmsv02 " | at now + 1 hour
    3. Disable after 10 days
      echo "sudo /prod/images/scripts/manage_sudo disable x1kxk630 panmsv02 " | at now + 10 day
